00032 typedef unsigned long long rthal_time_t;

00034 #define __rthal_u64tou32(ull, h, l) ({                  \
00035         union { unsigned long long _ull;                \
00036             struct { u_long _h; u_long _l; } _s; } _u;  \
00037         _u._ull = (ull);                                \
00038         (h) = _u._s._h;                                 \
00039         (l) = _u._s._l;                                 \
00040         })
00041 
00042 #define __rthal_u64fromu32(h, l) ({                     \
00043         union { unsigned long long _ull;                \
00044             struct { u_long _h; u_long _l; } _s; } _u;  \
00045         _u._s._h = (h);                                 \
00046         _u._s._l = (l);                                 \
00047         _u._ull;                                        \
00048         })
00049 
00050 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ullmul(const unsigned long m0, 
00051                                               const unsigned long m1)
00052 {
00053     return (unsigned long long) m0 * m1;
00054 }
00055 
00056 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00057                                                const unsigned long uld,
00058                                                unsigned long *const rp)
00059 {
00060 #if defined(__KERNEL__) && BITS_PER_LONG == 32
00061     const unsigned long r = __div64_32(&ull, uld);
00062 #else /* !__KERNEL__ || BITS_PER_LONG == 64 */
00063     const unsigned long r = ull % uld;
00064     ull /= uld;
00065 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00066 
00067     if (rp)
00068         *rp = r;
00069 
00070     return ull;
00071 }
00072 
00073 #define rthal_uldivrem(ull,ul,rp) ((u_long) rthal_ulldiv((ull),(ul),(rp)))
00074 
00075 static inline int rthal_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00076 
00077     /* Returns (int)i = (unsigned long long)i*(u_long)(mult)/(u_long)div. */
00078     const unsigned long long ull = rthal_ullmul(i, mult);
00079     return rthal_uldivrem(ull, div, NULL);
00080 }
00081 
00082 static inline __attribute_const__
00083 unsigned long long __rthal_ullimd (const unsigned long long op,
00084                                    const unsigned long m,
00085                                    const unsigned long d)
00086 {
00087     u_long oph, opl, tlh, tll, qh, rh, ql;
00088     unsigned long long th, tl;
00089 
00090     __rthal_u64tou32(op, oph, opl);
00091     tl = rthal_ullmul(opl, m);
00092     __rthal_u64tou32(tl, tlh, tll);
00093     th = rthal_ullmul(oph, m);
00094     th += tlh;
00095 
00096     qh = rthal_uldivrem(th, d, &rh);
00097     th = __rthal_u64fromu32(rh, tll);
00098     ql = rthal_uldivrem(th, d, NULL);
00099     return __rthal_u64fromu32(qh, ql);
00100 }
00101 
00102 static inline long long rthal_llimd (long long op,
00103                                      unsigned long m,
00104                                      unsigned long d)
00105 {
00106 
00107     if(op < 0LL)
00108         return -__rthal_ullimd(-op, m, d);
00109     return __rthal_ullimd(op, m, d);
00110 }

00112 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long ul) {
00113 
00114     __asm__ ("cntlzw %0, %1" : "=r" (ul) : "r" (ul & (-ul)));
00115     return 31 - ul;
00116 }

00133 static inline unsigned long long rthal_rdtsc (void) {
00134     unsigned long long t;
00135     rthal_read_tsc(t);
00136     return t;

00139 #if defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE) && !defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS)
00140 
00141 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the
00142    Xenomai domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task
00143    address using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack
00144    pointer instead. */
00145 
00146 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid) {
00147     return ((struct thread_info *)(rthal_root_domain->esp[cpuid] & (~8191UL)))->task;
00148 }
00149 
00150 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid)
00151 
00152 {
00153     register unsigned long esp asm ("r1");
00154     
00155     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 8192)
00156         return rthal_root_host_task(cpuid);
00157 
00158     return current;
00159 }
00160 
00161 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE || CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00162 
00163 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid) {
00164     return current;
00165 }
00166 
00167 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid) {
00168     return current;
00169 }
00170 
00171 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE && !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */

00173 static inline void rthal_timer_program_shot (unsigned long delay)
00174 {
00175     if(!delay) delay = 1;
00176 #ifdef CONFIG_40x
00177     mtspr(SPRN_PIT,delay);
00178 #else /* !CONFIG_40x */
00179     set_dec(delay);
00180 #endif /* CONFIG_40x */
00181 }

00192 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU

00194 typedef struct rthal_fpenv {
00195     
00196     /* This layout must follow exactely the definition of the FPU
00197        backup area in a PPC thread struct available from
00198        <asm-ppc/processor.h>. Specifically, fpr[] an fpscr words must
00199        be contiguous in memory (see arch/ppc/hal/fpu.S). */
00200 
00201     double fpr[32];
00202     unsigned long fpscr_pad;    /* <= Hi-word of the FPR used to */
00203     unsigned long fpscr;        /* retrieve the FPSCR. */
00204 
00205 } rthal_fpenv_t;
00206

00208 
00209 void rthal_save_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00210 
00211 void rthal_restore_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);

00213 #ifndef CONFIG_SMP
00214 #define rthal_get_fpu_owner(cur) last_task_used_math
00215 #else /* CONFIG_SMP */
00216 #define rthal_get_fpu_owner(cur) ({                             \
00217     struct task_struct * _cur = (cur);                          \
00218     ((_cur->thread.regs && (_cur->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))   \
00219      ? _cur : NULL);                                            \
00220 })
00221 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00222     
00223 #define rthal_disable_fpu() ({                          \
00224     register long _msr;                                 \
00225     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mfmsr %0" : "=r"(_msr) );   \
00226     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mtmsr %0"                   \
00227                            : /* no output */            \
00228                            : "r"(_msr & ~(MSR_FP))      \
00229                            : "memory" );                \
00230 })
00231 
00232 #define rthal_enable_fpu() ({                           \
00233     register long _msr;                                 \
00234     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mfmsr %0" : "=r"(_msr) );   \
00235     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mtmsr %0"                   \
00236                            : /* no output */            \
00237                            : "r"(_msr | MSR_FP)         \
00238                            : "memory" );                \
00239 })
00240 
00241 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
